snippet: David Wright signed up to be the bridge to the next winning Mets team. The Mets have staggered through five losing seasons in a row, threatening to waste the prime years of their best player.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column notes that New York Mets third baseman David Wright is among game's best, but has been playing for losing team; Wright, under contract with the team through 2020, has already been in New York City longer than almost any other active Met or Yankee except for Derek Jeter.
lead_paragraph: David Wright signed up to be the bridge to the next winning Mets team. The Mets have staggered through five losing seasons in a row, threatening to waste the prime years of their best player.

headline.main: Mets’ Wright Waits for His Team to Catch Up
headline.print_headline: Mets’ Wright Waits for His Team to Catch Up
